# kCFStreamPropertyHTTPAttemptPersistentConnection | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ CFNetwork ](/documentation/cfnetwork)

- [ kCFStreamPropertyHTTPAttemptPersistentConnection ](/documentation/CFNetwork/kCFStreamPropertyHTTPAttemptPersistentConnection)

-  kCFStreamPropertyHTTPAttemptPersistentConnection 

Global Variable# kCFStreamPropertyHTTPAttemptPersistentConnection

iOS 2.0–9.0DeprecatediPadOS 2.0–9.0DeprecatedMac Catalyst 13.1–13.1DeprecatedmacOS 10.2–10.11DeprecatedtvOS 9.0–9.0DeprecatedvisionOS 1.0–1.0Deprecated

```
let kCFStreamPropertyHTTPAttemptPersistentConnection: CFString
```

Deprecated

Use NSURLSession API for http requests

## [Discussion](/documentation/CFNetwork/kCFStreamPropertyHTTPAttemptPersistentConnection#Discussion)

HTTP Attempt Persistent Connection property. The value of this property is a CFBoolean. If this property is set to `kCFBooleanTrue`, the HTTP stream looks for an appropriate existing persistent connection to use. If it cannot find one, the HTTP stream will try to create one.
